content:
Based on the data you provided, it looks like you had a strong run with a good average pace and consistent splits. Here are a few suggestions to continue improving your running:

1. Work on pacing: While your overall pace was strong, you did slow down a bit towards the end of your run. Try working on maintaining a consistent pace throughout your runs by focusing on your breathing, staying relaxed, and monitoring your cadence.
2. Improve cadence: Your average cadence of 165 steps per minute is good, but it's worth working on increasing it to around 180 steps per minute to improve your efficiency and reduce your risk of injury. Try using a metronome or music with a consistent beat to help you maintain a higher cadence.
3. Incorporate hills: Hills are a great way to build strength and endurance. Look for routes with some inclines or add hill repeats to your training routine.
4. Mix up your workouts: While tempo runs are great for building speed and endurance, it's also important to incorporate different types of workouts to keep your training varied and challenging. Consider adding interval training, long slow runs, or other types of workouts to your routine.
5. Monitor heart rate: Your average and maximum heart rates suggest that you had a challenging workout. Keep an eye on your heart rate during runs to ensure you're not overdoing it and allow for proper recovery between runs.

Overall, keep up the good work and continue focusing on your training to help you achieve your running goals.
